sentence.Network_en: If you don't subsidize ballet and opera, seat prices will have to go up to pay for it.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果你不为芭蕾和歌剧提供补贴，就得提高剧场票价来为此买单。

sentence.Network_en: The government continues to subsidize the production of eggs and beef.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府继续出资扶持鸡蛋和牛肉的生产。

sentence.Network_en: Many universities subsidize research and publications.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多大学资助研究和出版.

entry.def: If a government or other authority subsidizes something, they pay part of the cost of it.

example.ex: Around the world, governments have subsidized the housing of middle and upper-income groups...
example.tran: 全世界各国政府都为中高收入群体提供过住房补贴。

example.ex: At the moment they are existing on pensions that are subsidised by the government.
example.tran: 此刻他们正依靠政府发放的养老金维持生计。

entry.def: If a government subsidizes an industry, they provide money so that the industry can continue.

example.ex: The government continues to subsidize the production of eggs and beef.
example.tran: 政府继续出资扶持鸡蛋和牛肉的生产。

example.ex: ...a government decision to subsidise coal mining.
example.tran: 政府资助煤矿开采的决定

sentences.sentence: "The arts in Europe are heavily subsidized"

means.word_mean: 2. secure the assistence of by granting a subsidy, as of nations or military forces

auth_sentence.content: His family were unlikely to subsidize further adventures.
auth_sentence.res_content: His family were unlikely to subsidize further adventures.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His family were unlikely to subsidize further adventures.

auth_sentence.content: In Afghanistan, we must subsidize the cultivation of alternative crops to the poppy.
auth_sentence.res_content: In Afghanistan, we must subsidize the cultivation of alternative crops to the poppy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In Afghanistan, we must subsidize the cultivation of alternative crops to the poppy.

jushi.english: Farming is partly subsidized by the government.
jushi.chinese: 农业得到政府的部分资助。
